p: Compound 2 was assigned a molecular formula of C 22H 29NO 6 based on the HRESIMS data for the [M + H] + ion at m/ z 404.2064 (calcd for C 22H 30NO 6 +, m/ z 404.2068, Δ = 0.8 ppm) and the [M + Na] + ion at m/ z 426.1884 (calcd for C 22H 29NO 6Na +, m/ z 426.1887, Δ = 0.8 ppm). Tandem MS (MS/MS) data of the [M + Na] + ion showed high similarity to those of compound 1, and the same stable C 7H 7NO 4Na + fragment ion at m/ z 192.0269, containing the N-methoxy-pyridone ring, was observed. In contrast to 1, 2 was detected in negative ion mode, where the [M – H] − ion underwent complete in-source fragmentation, mainly because of the loss of CO 2. Further fragmentation of the [M–CO 2–H] − ion and several indicative fragment ions of the [M + Na] + ion pointed toward the presence of a carboxylic acid group in the side chain ( Figures S6–S8, Schemes S3–S5).
